styles

Class Style

  • java.lang.Object
    • styles.Style
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InlineStyle

    public abstract class Style
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is what gathers different properties applicable to an element.
    Author:
    Bruno Quercia

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Style()

      Creates a style with some properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Style

        public Style()
        Creates an empty style with no properties.

      • Style

        public Style(PropertySet properties)
        Creates a style with some properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to associate to the style.

      • Style

        public Style(PropertySet properties,
             Style parentStyle)
        Creates a style with properties and a parent style. All the properties of the parent style are automatically added to the new style. If the parent contains a property that is also in properties, the value of the parent property gets overwritten. For example if the parent contains 'font-weight: bold' and 'font-weight: normal' is added, the final value will be 'normal'.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to associate to the style.
        parentStyle - the parent style.

      • Style

        public Style(Style s)

    • Method Detail

      • getProperties

        public PropertySet getProperties()
        Returns:
        the properties of this Style.

      • addProperty

        public boolean addProperty(Property p)
        Adds a property to the Style. If the property already exists, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        p - property to be added
        Returns:
        success.

      • addProperties

        public boolean addProperties(PropertySet p)
        Adds a set of properties to the Style. This will have the same result as a series of addProperty over p.
        Parameters:
        p - set of properties.
        Returns:
        success.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Style p)
        Sets the parent of the Style. All properties are discarded, the Style becomes identical to its parent.
        Parameters:
        p - the new parent.

      • getParent

        public Style getParent()
        Returns the parent element of the Style, null if it has none.
        Returns:

      • removeProperty

        public void removeProperty(java.lang.String label,
                           java.lang.String value)
        Removes a property from the Style.
        Parameters:
        label - name of the property.
        value - value of the property.
